text: 16 oz can from my son The IPA poured a cloudy amber color with frothy head and lacing. The aroma of pineapple blended with other tropical fruits. An excellent IPA living up to the Brewerys reputation. The taste was full of more pineapple, citrus and peach. The ale has a medium body with average carbonation. Nicely constructed ale. Complex taste with only modest bitterness.
AaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaAaaaa via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Can pour. Incredible floral and citrusy aroma. Pours a cloudy yellow amber. Medium bodied. Medium sweetness, lightly bitter. Very smooth finish, if not a tiny bit weak. Overall very good.

500ml can. Fresh floral and citrusy hops. Taste floral and juicy citrusy. Finish floral and citrusy. Light piny notes. Smooth. Moderate bitterness. Really well balanced. Not the most aromatic but still world class.

Pours a very hazy, orange-yellow, with mid-sized, lasting head. Aroma of tropical and citrus fruits, with some hops notable. Flavor is very smooth, almost no bitterness, with peach, grapefruit, and piney hops noticeable. Very soft, smooth mouthfeel and finish. Outstanding.
Very hazy yellow. Smells like pineapple and peaches. Dank. Fluffy and dry mouthfeel. Amazing

Draft at Armsby Abbey. Pours pineapple yellow with a thick, pillowy white head. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Lots of tropical fruit on the nose. Nice blend of pine and citrus on the tongue. Finished clean. Nice example of the now popular New England IPA.

Superb IPA. Love that juicy kick with perfect hop level, delivering journey in citrus grove, some pine, tropical fruits, pronounced peach, tangerine. Perfect maltiness in background makes it kinda milky.
Moderate bitterness with light sweetness. Awesome.
Can shared at the May THT. Pours a murky yellow juice. Pungent hops, spicy kick, tropical fruits, grapefruit. Nice.

Can at THT thanks to PotjeBier who just left us, cheers. Some green onion, papaya, fruity pineapple but also the spicy touch that pineapple has, light fruity chili, light strawberries. Medium sweet and under medium bitter. Medium bodied with spicy hoppy finish. Nice!
Can shared at May THT. Hazy orange with a white head. Notes of dank onions, strawberries, tropical fruit, white grapes, vanilla milkshake, hop spice. Complex and decently balanced.

THT May at Kwartje. Massive thanks to potjebier for this! Hazy yellow-golden, thin white head. Sweet malts, grass, hay, almond, onions, grilled onion. Medium sweet and light bitter. Medium body, fizzy carbonation. Very nice!

I can see where this is a great IPA, though perhaps my can was a little old. Had a slightly tangy flavour riding over the big guava and pineapple flavours. Solid but would love another go around with this.

Sampled from a 16 oz can, shared generously by Patrick and Andrew, thanks guys! Cloudy, opaque yellow/orange color. Not much of a head. Aromas: in your face juicy, resin, fruit, light bitterness. Retronasal about the same. Flavor is light moderate bitter, juicy, with some light malty sweetness. Medium bodied. Finishes with lots of juice, resin and moderate bitterness. Lovely!
Yellow hazy with medium white head. Sweet fruity aroma. Good bitterness with strong fruity sourness, fruity. (mango, melon) notes.
Extremely strong aroma. A bit muddy appearance. Golden color. Mild for Ip, but very fresh and like melts in mouth

Can - Cloudy amber with a ring of white head. Nose is citrus, tropical fruit, and a dry malt base. Taste is rarely nice--its bright and fruity hops, a little pine bitterness and a dry malt base. Pretty thick in the mouth.
Can at home. Pours hazy golden with a quite thick white head. Aroma is very much oranges, taste is citrus, tropical fruits and pine. Moderate bitterness. Great stuff!

From crowler, courtesy of dpjuart. Apricot and cat-pee nose, wonderfully aromatic. Hazy pale golden with thin head. Medium body with medium carbonation. Tasty, hoppy, good level of sweetness. Juicy hop flavors with just the right amount of bitterness. Fruity hoppy after.

Tasted from can. Pours a hazy murky orange with thick rocky white head. Huge orange aroma with some lemon and tropical fruits. Taste is incredibly balanced with flavors of orange, tropical fruits, lemon. Incredible fruity IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a golden orange with a decent head which dissipates fairly quickly. Pine and citrus flavors with a good amount of hop flavor. This continues to be my favorite non DDH from Trillium. I wish they made it more often.
16 oz can. 2/1/17 date. Cloudy yellow/orange. Aroma is orange pineapple, pine. Taste citrius and some bitterness. Delicious and super drinkable.
Pours hazy golden orange with a medium white fluffy head. Aroma is citrus, melon, tropical fruits and pine. Taste is moderate bitters. Clean and crisp finish. Overall this is delicious.

Cloudy orange pour from can from a friend. Thick perfect foam. The nose hit the second I started to pour. Pineapple, peach, clementine, juicy hop and warm butter. Tastes...smooth and unexpectedly not like it smells. Balanced malty hop, still juicy nugget, butter, orange peel and mango. Medium body and only hardly bitter; moreso malt in the finish.

16oz can. Thin bright white head of fine bubbles. Amazing aroma with lots of citrus. Lemon and pineapple, light malts, bit of herbal hops as it breathes a bit. Color is a bright golden orange. Fresh and fruity flavor. Crisp apple, dried grains, lemon grass, straw and a bit of grapefrut pith. Light alcohol presence. Great balance. Bit of malt to offset the luscious bitter hops. Clean palate and easy drinking. Moderate bitterness and zippy mouthfeel. A damn good IPA.

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2017 On [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */: pours cloudy golden with foamy white head. Aroma-flavor: huge & intense hop aroma, with notes of tropical fruits, supported with biscuit like malt notes. Hop bitterness is very high, lingers long in aftertaste. Body is moderate, texture almost juicy, carbonation is moderate.
Pours a gorgeous hazy gold. Big aroma of grapefruit, pineapple, mango and pine. Taste is luscious citrus, melon and pineapple. Rich, velvety mouthfeel. Awesome and excellent.

Aroma of pine, citrus, melon, grapefruit, toffee - very piney. Taste of nectarine, apricot, pine, melon with a piney bitter finish. Very creamy and quite full mouthfeel - one of the best of all trillium beers. Solid and drinkable, tad bit too bitter.

Canette de 16 oz partagée lors dune dégustation entre amis. Arôme: Odeur de fruits tropicaux avec une pointe dhoublons résineux. Apparence: La couleur est orange opaque avec une très faible densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût dananas et de mangue avec une pointe de pin. Longue durée de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère présence dananas en arrière goût. (Rating #7159)

Can. Nose of durian, mango, brilliant tropical fruits, plus dank and resinous to boot. Profound nose. Lovely tropical fruit flavor, some chili pepper, pineapple. Soft, light and dank. Seductive and beautiful.
Hazy yellowish body with a thick, foamy head. Aromas of melon, cracker, biscuit. Juicy melon character throughout. Medium bodied, juicy, moderate bitterness in the finish. Nice.

Aroma - resin, slight pine, citrus that comes off as lemon, grapefruit, pineapple, and mango, and floral hops.
Appearance - the body is an opaque and hazy sunglow, with a 2" off-white head, that settles very slowly.
Taste - has a mashup of pungent, citrus, and floral hops. The citrus element is a composite of starfruit, lemon, pineapple, and mango. 
Palate - medium body, velvety texture, average carbonation, and a dry slightly floral, resin, pungent and bitter finish.

16oz can shared with Julien. Pours golden orange, very hazy beautiful looking beer with a foamy lacing off white head. Smells of a Trillium IPA fruit bomb through and through. Citrus, hops, little malts, wonderful. Tastes smooth, citrusy, hoppy, a nice dry wheat finish that cuts nicely. Smooth and full mouthfeel. A plus from Trillium.

UPDATED: NOV 21, 2016 Can shared at Piwoteka. Intense aroma of passion fruit, mango, papaya, pineapple, citrus. Taste is very light bitter, light dry, bitterness is short, smooth and beer is overall very balanced. Flavor is juicy, lots of tropical fruits and hint of resin. Perfection.

Got in a BIF from oline73. 16 ounce can into signature tulip glass, canned on 9/21/2016. Pours very hazy golden orange color with a 1-2 finger dense and rocky white head with good retention, that reduces to a nice cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass. Aromas of huge grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, lemon/orange peel, light pepper, pine, honey, wheat, cracker, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic complexity and balance of bright/juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of huge grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, lemon/orange peel, light pepper, pine, honey, wheat, cracker, bread, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate pine/grassy/citrus rind bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, lemon/orange peel, pepper, pine, honey, wheat, cracker, bread, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of bright/juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and zero lingering hop astringency after the finish. Light-moderate dryness from bitterness, increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/grainy/sticky, and lightly resinous balanced mouthfeel that is awesome. Zero warming alcohol for 7.2%. Overall this is an insane IPA! All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of bright/juicy citrus/tropical/pine hops and moderate bready malt flavors; very smooth and easy to drink with the modest bitterness. A highly amazing offering.
Can shared with the DB crew. Milky golden pour with a frothy off white head. Tons of juicy hops, mandarin overripe citrus, stone fruits and a light mellow bitterness.
pour cloudy pale with a fine white head aromas of lemon, pine, ananas. taste medium bitter. medium bodied, medium bitter aftertaste

16 oz can from dbarnold. Thanks! 9/21/16 date on the can. Pours a completely hazed orange color with a white head and some mid-plus lace-work. Fruity (orange, tangerine, and pineapple) and resiny pine aroma. Rind, pith, and the actual fruit part all come through. Taste is juicy sweet early, and turns fairly bitter (rind/resin) mid-palate through the close. These a lighter malt backbone in there as well that is almost oaty. Has a zip of carbonation on the mouth, with a nice dry close. Has more bitterness to it, and perhaps a bit more body, than the Melcher Street can that I had yesterday. Both are excellent, and Id happily drink a lot of both, but I think I prefer this ever so slightly.
16oz can thanks to Steve. Pours out a hazy cloudy gold topped with white head. Nose is nice tropical fruits citrus sweetness. Taste is more of the nice tropical fruits citrus pithy notes.
Can. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of dank hops, passion, papaya, pineapple, mango, peach and pine. Taste of dank hops, sweet Stone fruits - lots of mango. Peach, grapefruit and pine.

Yup 
Pour pretty hazy light orange with a smal white head. 
Aroma has tons of fruity juicy hoppy goodness, pine, pineapple, grass, danky "morning/morgen juice" 
Taste is pretty bitter, with a very well balanced slight malty (but really malty) sweetness to back u the hops. 
Medium bodied, with a mellow fizzy carb. Really nice.

Can. Pours hazy thick yellowish orange with a small white head. Aromas of passionfruit, guava, sweet melon, dank hops, citrus, sweet orange. Taste is dank, grassy, citrus, passion fruit, mango, papaya, subtle malt sweetness. Damn crushable
Thanks to Lukas for the taste! Wow. Tropical fruit, pineapple, citrus, passion fruit. Hazy yellow with white head. Light+ bitter and light sweet. Medium body, oily and smooth bitter finish.

16 oz can to pint. Looks good; a juice-like pineapplish mango with foamy eggshell head. Smells and tastes of clementines with a mildly bitter, juicy medium-bodied mouthfeel. Some tropical fruit as it warms and opens up ad well. Another winner from Trillium.
Pours a hazy orange with a thick white head. Aroma of peach, mango, passion fruit and grain. Taste follows, so much stonefruit and tropical fruit with a bitter grapefruity finish.

Super fresh can shared @Brasserie 4:20 (Rome), thank you DCLAguy11! Pours opalescent yellow with a medium head. Super fruity aroma, pineapple, peach, mango, passionfruit. Flavour is incredibly rich and well balanced, fruit juice, medium to light bitterness, alcohol is very well hidden. Medium body, velvet texture, medium to light carbonation. Amazing!
(can) cloudy yellow orange colour with a medium tall white head; aroma of grapefruit, jam; intense, balanced flavour with a long, light bitter finish; solid ipa

(Cannette provenant la brasserie): Un dégât dagrumes pulpeuses et quelques feuilles de menthe et forment une espèce de purée tropicale. La texture finement carbonatée facilite la buvabilité à un niveau presque inacceptable.

Can at home. Aroma of passionfruit, orange, melon, mango, pine. 
Pours a lighter hazy and juicy yellow with a creamy white head. 
Taste is loads of prickly passionfruit, melon, mango, sweet orange, lemon. 
All about the hops. 
Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, soft carbonation, pithy finish. 
I love this IPA big time.

This beer has that candle wax golden color to it. Trillium does not seem too concerned with clarity. Big rocky ivory head that left sheets of lacing on the glass. Big fresh citrus peel nose. Lots of hop flavors with orange peel and grapefruit juice all over a strong malt backbone. An initial sweetness gives way to the long, dry bitterness. Long grapefruit zest finish. Nice hop juice beer.
Hazy gold pour, larger head. Tropical fruit in the aroma, peach, citrus. Hoppy up front, peach, pineapple, passionfruit, lighter malt backbone. Medium body, soft, slick mouthfeel.
on tap at armsby abbey. top ipa. very drinkable and beautiful colour.smooth.
Can on 8/20. Pours an orange yellow haze. Light citrus aroma. Citrus bitterness, pineapple. Lingering aftertaste. Really nice stuff.

UPDATED: SEP 11, 2016 Can. Pours a cloudy light golden orange with a mostly lasting lacy off white head. Aroma is of pine, grapefruit, citrus, peach, passionfruit. Taste is of grapefruit, passionfruit, citrus, melon. Soft, foamy to oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.
Can. Congress Street is a cloudy straw gold with a big tropical hop bouquet. The tasten is crackery pale malt and bitter prickly pear and pine. Smells awesome tastes solid.

Appearance: opaque pale amber with one fat finger of creamy ivory head, good retention and moderate lacing. (4/5) Aroma: resiny and slightly dank pine, juicy oranges, pineapple, stone fruit, biscuity pale malt. (10/10) Taste: moderate sweet, moderate-high bitter. (9/10) Medium body, moderate carbonation, off-dry slightly sticky and mildly warming finish. (4/5)

Big piney/citrusy/pineappley notes from the Australian Galaxy hops, hints of stone fruit and floral, and just enough biscuity pale malt to support things, with a lovely mouth feel, and just the right amount of gentle warming in the finish. Very well-balanced and just a lovely beer all-round. (18/20)

Four pack of cans from the brewery. Pours out super cloudy and orange. Thin white head. Lots of fruity-pine notes on the aroma. Mouthfeel is fizzy and very dry and bready. Bitterness is more dry than truly bitter. Palate sucks. Astringent finish.
Bottle. Color dark yellow with medium white head. Aroma citrus, pine, woody, grapes, peach, spicy, tangerines. Taste pine, mango, lemon, peach, floral.

Tasted on 8/10/16 from a 16oz can, big thanks to Alex. Pours cloudy pale orange with a thick white head that slowly recedes to average, sticky lace. The nose is pretty soft, a nice blend of grassy floral hops, along with hints of mango and passion fruit. The flavor is floral with some honeysuckle, the same passion fruit and mango from the nose, with some lightly bitter grassy green notes, and just a bit of bread malt. The body is just under full with average carbonation, and a long lightly bitter grassy, honeyed, and floral finish.
Fantastically made. Creamy and citrusy with good underlying bitterness that sometimes gets lost in the New England style. Great, balanced, and extremely drinkable IPA.
Pours hazy, golden. Aroma is full of fresh tropical fruit. Taste is great, juicy melon and orange, nice hoppiness, smooth finish.

(16oz tall can) very cloudy, juicy pulpy medium gold-orange with fine white bubbles. Nose of juicy pineapple and melon, some citrus zest, light bitterness, candied hops. Taste of juicy oranges, citrus zest, some pine without being super bitter, balanced juicy and bitter IPA. Medium thick body.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2016 Tap at the source, Canton. Pours again, Trillium hazy golden grapefruit fruit juice, white head. Aroma is dank, pine, mango, grapefruit, tangerine, candied orange, tropical fruit. That might actually be one of the best smelling beers I?ve had. Flavor is pine, orange rind, mango, grapefruit, bit of sweetness, medium bitterness finish. Aroma is amazing, flavor is great but shame it?s not quite as good.

Hazy golden yellow, small white head. Citrus and grassy aroma. Medium body, light carbonation. Flavor is very citrusy and bitter but not overly so. Some herb and yeast flavors. Quite tasty, a bit less intense than some of their other offerings.
Pours very hazy blonde, like a yeastshot, the whole can trough ! Smell is citrussy, some lemon, bitter. Taste is sharp, bitter, citrussy. Some lemon. Refreshing.

Great tasting IPA with hints of pine , pineapple , and citrus. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can, only 10 days old. Pours a murky milky pale golden beer with a small white head on top. Aroma of white fruits, grapes, lemon, lemongrass and lime. Flavor is very citrussy, full on hops, resinous, grassy. Amazing full bodied, well carbonated. Awesome stuff.

From the 750 ml. bottle. Translucent, milky pale yellow pour under a modest white head. The aroma is alive with citrus, pine, and melon hops with a more mellow toasted bread character. Medium or better body. The taste begins with a quick toast sweetness and then the hop bitterness kicks in. I would say the melons are more predominant in the flavor than the other hop characters I picked up. Another astounding beer from Trillium. Not sure if I give it a 100% but it is right up there.

Aroma is great. Lots of citrus, orange peel, tropical fruit, pine, juicy as fuck. Appearance is ugly, hazy golden amber, super cloudy. Taste is wonderful. Juicy, citrus, tropical fruit, pine, my god is this good. Mouthfeel is light body, light crisp carbonation, orange peel and pine aftertaste. Overall, damn this one is so good.

Courtesy of Darshan
Bottle: The aroma consists of big citrus/orange, tropical fruits, grapefruit, and lemon peel. It pours a cloudy dull golden-orange with a small white head that fades to a minimal film outlined by a thin ring. The flavor starts with moderate citrus, tropical fruits, and a touch of pineapple. The finish has moderate moderate grapefruit, citrus peel and and dank hops. Its light-medium bodied with mild carbonation and a somewhat soft mouthfeel.
Entirely opaque. Little carbonation and next to no head. Fresh fruit in the aroma and flavor, some pineapple. This is good but not 100th percentile.
Hazy light pale yellow in color with a white head. Awesome nose - tropical and small citrus fruit. Big hoppy taste, citrus, light bitterness in the finish. Nice.
Shared 25.4 oz. bottle. Cloudy gold/orange with a white head. Intense aroma of citrus and tropical fruit. Taste follows nose. Moderate bitterness. very good.

Bottle, 750ml. Hazy golden with a frothy head. Fruity aroma with citrics, guava and some floral hints. Taste is moderately bitter with medium to low sweetness. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation and faint astringency. Fruity and hoppy aftertaste that reminds me of melon. Very drinkable.

Bottle, 750ml. Opaque golden/amber with a creamy offwhite head. Aromas of tropical hops, caramel. Medium to full bodied with moderate to fizzy carbonation. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Fruity, light hoppy character into a fizzy tropical finish. Very nice.

Bouteille 750ml, gracieuseté de tom10101, merci Tommy! Couleur jaune orangée trouble, mousse blanc cassé voluptueuse laissant une belle dentelle. Arôme dagrumes, houblon résineux, malt pâle, zeste de pomélo, gazon fraîchement coupé, pêche. Goût dagrumes, mangue, houblon résineux, malt, un peu de cannabis, bonne amertume. Carbonatation moyenne, corps moyen-dense, texture ample. Superbe.

Bottle into a cloudy opaque yellow with a finger of clean white foam.

The nose shows ripe pineapples.

The palate is light bodied and moderately carbonated. Flavors of very clean light pineapple and citrus fruits of tangerine and mandarin oranges with a moderate zesty spiciness. Practically no bitterness on the finish.

On tap. Pours a super cloudy light orange with a thick white head. Aroma of grassy hops, hop oils, citrus, pulp. Flavor of citrus, grapefruit, orange, grassy hops, earthy hops, grainy malts, seedy. Very delicious! Great hops/malt profile.
7/4/9/4/16 (4.0/5)

Aroma: lots of fruity pine notes and very aromatic; Appearance: hazy orange pour with thin, white head that hangs around; Taste: bitter with lots of undertones of other flavors, including a little bit of the green onion which is not my favorite; similar to some other trillium brews; Palate: medium body with long, bitter, slightly oniony finish; Overall: quite good but again cant quite get past the green onion.

750 ml bottle from the South Boston brewery, packaged on 4/7/16. Pours a hazy light orange with little head but nice lacing. Strong hay aroma with some light grass, citrus and tropical fruit notes nicely balanced by the sharp but dry lingering pinecone finish. Well done.

Larôme de cette Congress Street est incroyable : des fruits tropicaux en quantité industrielle donne à cette bière un nez incroyable! En bouche, cest un peu plus amer, très pêche, un peu agrumé, ce qui est un peu décevant au regard de larôme incroyable. Ça reste un liquide de très, très haute qualité, laissant entrevoir une haute maitrise du houblon par les brasseurs. Larôme tellement prometteuse ne correspond toutefois pas au goût - ce qui est une légère déception. Mais pas trop non plus, tellement cest bien fait.

Bottle, tasting of various trillium stuff. The pour is the most orangish, hazy, decent head. The aroma is big citrus, pineapple. The taste has a lot of hops of course, pretty mild though. Solid. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Sample share by someone at DLD 2016. Poured hazy orange yellow with white head. Aroma citrusy dank musk. Light carb med bod. Taste similar to aroma balanced bitter.

Chalky hazed golden color with nice sudsy white head. Piney, citrus aroma with hints of pineapple. Flavor carries the same profile as the aroma and is quite dry leaving you thirsting for another sip. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

750ml bottle dated 3/8/16. 

Super cloudy pour with amazing aroma. 

Super lingering bitterness. 

Solid beer.

750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Originally reviewed 4/6/2015.

Bright yellow orange. Nice white head and great lacing inside the glass.

Smells of bright orange hops. Cracker malt. A little piney.

All citrus hops in the taste. Orange hops. A little grapefruit. Cracker malt. Light pale malt sweetness. Low bitterness.

A little astringent. Medium body. Well carbonated.

Another hit from Trillium.
On tap at RateBeer Best 2016. Pour is bright hazy yellow. Notes of tropical fruit, citrus rind, biscuit malt, and a touch of pine. Finish has added dry cracker notes.
Bottle. Orange juice color and murky. Big hop tropical aroma. Taste is fresh hop, tropical punch and citrus fruit. Slight dry finish

Bottle courtesy of rlgk. Pours hazy milky yellow with a frothy white head that leaves some sparse lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity and slightly grassy with crackers, freshly baked white bread, grapefruit juice, pineapple, lychee, wild strawberries, freshly cut grass, pine needles, minerals and lemon zest. Taste is tiny bitter, very tiny sour, heavy fruity and slightly grassy. mouthfeel is soft, round, tiny flat, tiny dry and medium bodied. Finish is very tiny sweet, tiny bitter and very tiny sour with silly amounts of juice fruity hops. Holy crap thats some amazing fruit juice!
Pours hazy pale golden with a small head. Aroma is dry crispy citrucy fruity hoppy. Flavor is wow so good, pungent bitter fruity citric fresh.

Sample at The Trillium and Tree House-tasting in Kville, Göteborg. Cloudy golden beer with a nice lasting offwhite head. Hoppy citrus aroma, pine, woody, grapes, peach, spicy, mango, lemon zest, tangerines, some caramel. Hoppy pine flavor, mango, lemon juice, peach, orange zest, floral notes, pine apples, some star fruit.
A: Cloudy white/yellow coloured with a white head N: Papaya, grapes T: Grapes, pine, forest O: Murky forest juice! Nice!
Poured from bottle purchased at Redstone hazy lemony color with a nice white head. Aromas of tart citrus pineapple mango and dank pine. Taste is slightly sweet mango scallions and herbal grass. Nice.
Bottle. Pours Hazy Dark Golden Orange. Aroma is orange, grapefruit, papaya, pineapple and pine. Taste grapefruit, orange and pine with a sweet and bitter hoppy finish. I like it a lot.
Hot damn. Some tasty hops. Juicy tropical mango and ripe pineapple. Cloudy yellow color.

Bottle, pours cloudy golden with Medium white head. Smell is dirty mango, orange, grapefruit, and grass. Flavor is ultra bitter hops, grain, ash. Really drying in the finish. Still solid but we had a few better ipas this day. Too much columbus in these trilliums.

750ml bottle from the brewery. bottled on Feb 10. Aroma: wow! Juicy oranges, peaches and a tiny tiny bit of pines. App: cant see through orange like an orange juice, medium white head leaving big lacing on my glass. Taste and palate: Medium body, juicy, fruity, medium crisp bitter finish. Overall: damn! Thats great! That beer reminds me of Julius. As fruity as Julius. Really awesome beer. Wish I tasted one before trading my other one. Will sure buy some more next time I visit Boston.

From notes (Aug. 2015). This is a great showcase of both Galaxy hops and Trilliums strength as a brewery. The base beer is crisp and just a little grainy, which allows the Galaxy to really dominate. The hop profile is ripe peaches, orange zest, and pineapple. Fantastic IPA from one of Americas best breweries.

Bottles and draught since debut, most recently bottled 1/27/16 and drunk 2/4 and 2/5/16.Not sure why I never got around to rating this one. Always an enjoyable beer and though its a bit bigger than Fort Point, its one of my favorite of the street series, despite not loving Galaxy hops. Theyre done with much less tang/punch than in many other Galaxy IPAs and the lush fruitiness really shines. Even though its a notch bigger than fort point, abv-wise, its still quite drinkable, with a perfect texture and tight carbonation. Great attenuation, as their IPAs/pales always have and a lovely soupy appearance but yet with a full, well-retained white head. Big bouquet of cumquat, pineapple, lemon-orange and very light herb/spice notes in the nose. No alcohol or flaw noted in flavor or aroma.

Wonderful stuff. This bottle is super fresh as well. Lots of citrus, some peel and some hint of pepper. Pours hazy orange with great head and lacing. Bitter and peel astringent finish with some tang. Some pineapple. Bottle from Canton brewery.
On tap at ratebeer beerfest 2016. Pours copper with white head. Taste is bitter with a big citrus an pine hop taste. Light on the malts

Draught at RateBeer Best festival. Hazy orange liquid with medium white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, mango, light grain and fresh hops. Taste is dry and medium bitter with notes of tangerine, citrus and light grain. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Solid.
Bottle shared by a friend. Clear gold pour with a thick white head. Aroma of malt, tropical fruit and cucumber. Malty and piney flavor with cucumber character before a smooth tropical fruit finish.

Clear golden yellow in color... Aroma of tangerine, tropical fruits, pineapple, piney hops... Flavor is juicy tropical fruits, tangerines, pine hops on palate... Delicious

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle thanks to Dan (FooFaa). Pours fairly faint yellow with some haze and a medium sized white head. Aroma has hints of dankiness followed by fleshy fruit like apricot, peach, soft like fruit loops. Taste is lightly bitter, not overpowering, but present followed by soft, pillowy malt. Hop flavor seems more citrus and grass than the aroma would indicate. A light peppery finish. Pretty good!
750 ml. bottle. Pours a mostly clear golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, tropical, pine, and malt. Taste is grapefruit, pineapple, orange, lemon, pine, grass, and malt. Excellent.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2016 750 ml bottle shared with Anil which we scored outside of the Warren Store in a parking lot deal. Pours a cloudy gold yellow with a medium white head. Aroma of citrus, pine and malt. Taste dittos the aroma.

[7524-20150815] Bottle. Fragrant floral hops aroma. Hazy, pale orange body with a quick foamy white head. Bitter orange leaf flavour. Medium body is fairly bitter. Good. (8/3/8/4/15) 3.8
(@ Campground Brewdown 2015, Millmont, PA)

Pours hazy copper with thick white head. Smell is tons of mango and citrus fruit, pine, resin and hops. Taste is mango, tropical fruit, hops and resin. Medium body, light carb. Silky and light mouthfeel.

Simply one of the best IPAs Ive ever had. A melange of citrus and tropical fruit flavors rolls across the tongue. The aroma starts great and gets better, and for the style and abv, the feel is perfect. So good!!

Bottle shared by JulienHuxley, thanks man! Pours a pretty clear golden with a small white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of dank hops, tropical hops, resinous hops. Taste is moderately bitter with just enough sweetness to keep balance. Ultra orange-y flavors which I figure can only be amarillo. A nice hop showcase thats for sure. Body is medium, carbonation average and mouthfeel is not as juicy as some of their other IPAs are but still really nice. A nice hop juice, really. These guys are on top of their game!

Bottle 750ml. Thx Tom/Huxxy.
Pours golden with high light-beige head. Assertive lacing. Aroma is of watermelon, tropical fruits, flowers. Taste is of watermelon, tropical fruits, slight garlic, flowers. Palate: Medium body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Outstanding IPA. Crafty hops.

pours unclear light golden with a small white cap, reviving and leaving a creamy lacing. minty citrus, juicy melons, garlic, berries, doughy and almost buttery chewy maltiness. light carbonation, medium body - oily and creamy; balanced melon-citrusy finish. very clean and juicy. danky. excellent!

A BIG thanks to Clark for this fine beer! Cheers mate! De magnifiques dentelles laissées par une onctueuse et complexe mousse blanche se dessinent sur mon verre.Le liquide pour sa part brille et semble léger et plein de vie. Beaucoup de houblons fruités me laissant rêver à des arômes de mangue, dannanas et de malts bien jeunes. Le spectacle est moins explosif en bouche: texture plutôt aqueuse et de faire densité malgré une vive effervescence. Saveurs délicates de houblons qui manquent toutefois de complexité malgré une longue finale bien amère sans être toutefois ni capiteuse ni collante. Une bien belle IPA qui ouvre à merveille un tasting daprès-midi prometteur!

La bière se présente sous une lumière dorée et orangée plutôt trouble, et est surmontée dune mousse assez onctueuse qui laisse une dentelle lascive derrière elle. Dès louverture de la bouteille, les arômes houblonnés explosent. Même rendue dans le verre, la bière sent à des milles à la ronde. Des ananas et des agrumes dominent un aspect végétal aucunement dérangeant. Cest tout dabord une bombe citrique en bouche, avec un léger goût mentholé. Un beau petit sucre résiduel vient saccoter sur les saveurs fruitées enivrantes. Lorsque la bière tempère, lamertume se précise, mais elle nest aucunement agressive. Ma première bière de cette brasserie renommée et elle est spectaculaire.

Hazy gold pour, big foamy white head. Aroma of mango, pineapple, orange, melon, tangerine up front, settling into pine, earth and spice, flavor is similar, quite bitter, with notes of grass and earthy malt.
So much citrus on the nose, golden hazy goodness. Not my favorite from Triullium but an excellent IPA anyway.

2015-08-15. Murky orange body from the bottom of the bottle with a small white head. 3+ Aroma of orange citrus and orange juice. Flavour is moderately bitter , nice citrus and resin character. Average plus bodied palate, soft carbonation. Bottle at Campground Brewdown.

25/VII/15 - 75cl bottle from a trade @ Trillium tasting, home - BB: n/a, bottled: VI/22/15 (2015-988) Thanks to Thomas for muling this trade!
Cloudy orange beer, very big creamy off-white head, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: very resinous, pineapple, citrus, fruity, some passion fruit. MF: soft carbon, medium body. Taste: very resinous, not too bitter, lots of citrus, bit grassy, dry, fruity, slightly sweet, malty touch, some mango, pineapple. Aftertaste: bitter, grassy, some grapefruit, piny, bit resinous, fruity, pineapple.

75cl bottle. Medium white head atop cloudy apple cider body. Aroma is moderately sweet, pineapple, some mango, light tangerine. Taste is moderately sweet, mango, grapefruit, some pine. Soft light-medium body, light acidity.
the best application of Galaxy hops Ive had in a while. Juicy, juicy, juicy. from the aroma through the flavor and into the feel, its like drinking juice with a hop punch in the middle. so good.
Bomber from the brewery . Pours Cloudy yellow with white head. Nose/taste of grapefruit, pine, caramel malt, grass, nectarine. Some sweet pink grapefruit in nose. Medium body.

Growler fresh from the brewery. Cloudy apricot pour with a white head. Nice citrus and grassy bouquet. The taste is citrus with grass and muted resin hop notes. Well balanced with a sturdy caramel malt backbone. Good body and mouthfeel. Bitter but pleasantly so.

Beautiful hazy, apricot pulp yellow color, with a decent head. 

Smells flowery forward with wet grass in it, tied together by bready malts. Very dank, hop forward nose, featuring a nice hop balance, also revealing luscious, dried orange rind.

Has a medium carbonation, with a soft, smooth mouthfeel to it.

Tastes of orange peel wrapped up bread, accompanied by wet grass and a leafy, slightly herbal hoppiness. Utmost grassy with just the right amount of orange and lime, finishing with a sparkly, bitter dryness, still exhibiting the orange as well as the brews dankness.

Drinks amazingly easy, while providing a steamlined, focused hop presence, with a good amount of bitterness to it

75cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Tderoeck.
Dorée léger trouble devenant plus présent sur la fin, col fin blanc.
Arôme est agréablement houblonné, bouquet agréable dagrumes dégageant avec la levure un agréable côté rustique.
Palais est houblonné bien prenant, présentant pas mal dagrumes et des notes tropicales. Levure est assez dominante qui ajoute une impression un peu off pour un profil général assez convaincant. Se rapproche plus dun style IPA belge avec des notes de saison.

UPDATED: NOV 13, 2015 Thanks to tderoeck. IPA with stable, lacing, creamy, snow white head and cloudy, peach yellow blonde colour. Aroma of lemon zest, hemp, spruce shoots, apricot, field flowers, old cheese, buttermilk (probably still diacetyl as the bottle is apparently very young), grapefruit flesh; vividly fruity taste, apricot, pineapple but clean as most American IPAs, bit fizzy but not overcarbonated, light bready maltiness, early and very long, complex, refined hop profile, bittering and very aromatic, piney, citrussy, gentle and drying. Very elegant, fragrant, ethereal IPA.

Thanks to tderoeck! 750 ml. bottle split by five. 4 weeks old. Super cloudy orange, huge creamy white head. Nose is yeasty, dank fruity hops, white grapes, rustic, melon, hay, delicate, creamy, pepper, Taste is dry creamy grass, light sugar, pepper, melon, white grapes, pepper, very delicate & hugely creamy body. Very impressive & I preferred this one actually to the Double Hopped version which we had right after this one but I was the only one.

Bottle @ Clerko. Thanks to Leighton (probably) for sharing this! Gold pour with a large, prominent head. Sweet, bright mandarin orange on the nose. Delicate herbs, some pepper and dirt. Delicate flavor. Jasmine-rubbed orange peel. General herb garden. Bready base. Medium body, active carbonation. Great stuff.

Sample at Tomahawk Warriors First Birthday party on 06/06/2015: The beer is a slightly cloudy yellow-gold color with a medium fluffy white head that diminishes steadily. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of tropical fruit, hops and malt. Medium-bodied with flavors of floral hops, citrus, melon and toasted malt. The finish is moderately bitter with a fruity hops aftertaste. Enjoyable IPA all around.

Bottle from brewery. Hazy golden pour, aromas of tropical fruits. Taste is similar, but with more pine. Very very drinkable for a strong IPA. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared. Pours cloudy dull golden with an off white head. Aroma of pine, citrus, fruits, weedy hops and grapefruit. Flavour is light to moderate sweet and moderate to heavy bitter. Light medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle. Pours an opaquely hazed gold with a large white head. Musk on the nose, melon and honeyed citrus, some spiciness. Medium bodied, sweet fruity malt, a bit of lemon balm, musk. Long slow musk and gentle bitterness on the finish, faint warming alcohol coming through. Lots of delicate flavors here.

bottle from Brewery. real goood aroma, sweet, big peach orange streak. kind of honey. cloudy golden orange color, good head and lace, bitter sweet flavor.medium body, creamy mouthfeel, sweet bitter finish, Thats nice, really enjoy the aroma, though the whole thing is nice, great to look at. nice dry orange finish. Winner
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Thanks Rob!! Pours a hazy orange/wheat with a beautiful dense white head. The smell is full citrus, dry orange, grain...not overpowering yet elegant. The taste is orange, some grapefruit, grain and a touch of sweetness ending crisp with some bitterness lingering. Nice. Body is light+ with nice, tight carbonation.

Many thanks to Rian for sharing. Very fresh nose. The beer starts very viscous. Lots of pine and fresh green hops. Intense. Thick but great. Fresh intense aftertaste, round and hoppy with a not too sweet body. Great intense hoppy. Very nice.

750 mL bottle thanks to Dave (Ruck-It) on BA. The pour is incredibly cloudy and bright golden yellow. It almost looks like a juice. Its got a huge white head that falls down to half a finger leaving spectacular lacing. The aroma is very citrusy and incredibly hoppy. There is a beautiful pine resin about half way through that fades back to citrus hops on the end. It smells amazing. The flavor is just as good. A hit of dank hops at the front before a bright citrus comes blasting in. There is a good resin bitterness that is just perfectly timed. The mouth feel is great. Light, but thick at the same time with a soft carbonation that helps it linger beautifully. The aftertaste is bitter and citrusy. I am a huge fan of this beer! ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Super hazy straw colored body, medium to large white head, dense soapy lacing. Rindy grapefruit and orange, mango, light pineapple, and clean and mellow crackery malt. Medium bodied with silky soft carbonation, lively, but restrained bitterness. Another all-around excellent IPA from Tillium.

UPDATED: JUN 25, 2015 Pours a very bright and cloudy yellow with a thick foamy white head. Aromas of tropical and citrus fruit burst at you and smells complex. Flavor was mango, pineapple, orange, and grapefruit. Hoppy and good. Medium body and texture felt thick. Very fizzy cabonation, similar to pop. Not bad, but maybe a little too much. Pretty smooth finish. Only have tried a couple of their offerings, but wouldnt mind more.
750 ml bottle thanks to John. April 16 date? Big nose. Tropical fruit. Citrus. Mango. Taste is right there too. Hazy yellow pour. Excellent.

750ml bottle, thanks to JulienHuxley for sharing this. Milky blonde with a frothy bright white head. Flavors are bready cereals, tropical fruits, grapefruit, peach and resinous hops with grassy and floral notes. Medium body, soft carbonation, smooth texture.

750mL bottle, pours a cloudy yellow with a small white head. Nose is divine, with citrus hops, tropical fruitiness, pine and just enough biscuity malt. Flavour brings out tangy citrusy hops, some pine and a little tropical fruit. Loads of depth to this one. The malt is there just to hold things together. Dry, slightly bitter finish. Excellent.

Bottle (750 ml). From jcastle, thanks! Split 5-ways @ Hotel Room Tasting.

Appearance: Hazy glowing golden with a medium fluffy white head and good lacing. 

Aroma: Herbal hops with crackery malts, light spiciness, dank hops and citrus/tropical fruits.

Taste: Like most of the Trillium hoppy beers so far, the malt backone in this one is discrete but extremely effective. Quite herbal and dank with garlic, oniions, crackery malts, light spiciness and light bitterness. 

Palate: Medium body. Medium to good carbonation. Very oily mouthfeel. Vegetal finish. Dry. A bit sticky. 

Overall: Well balanced IPA. Nice herbal and dank hops features for both the aroma and the taste. Tasty, easy to drink and quenching. Another very good one from Trillium.

750ml bottle, from trade with bytemesis, shared with friends. Thank you Mike! Very hazy yellow-golden color with white head. Hoppy aroma, floral and herbal, basil - mallow notes, fruity, citrus and tropical fruits, light grassy. Sweet and bitter taste, hoppy fruity and herbal like the aroma and light malty. Medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.

Une belle bouteille partagée par des gens généreux, merci. Une robe jaune trouble. Un nez et une bouche tout en houblon frais, de fruits tropicaux. Franchement bon, rien de complexe mais des saveurs affirmés.

Arômes citronnés, fruits tropicaux, acidité fruitée, herbes et ou chanvre. Saveurs fruitées tropicales, petit sucre qui roule sur la langue, mangue ou papaye et/ou pêche. Présence correcte en bouche. Corps un peu mou qui machale un peu. Finale fruitée, pêche ou fruit semblable, herbes. Merci pour le partage!

Bottle at hotel room tasting. Hazy glowing gold pour with creamy white head, very heavy lacing. Aroma is really nice, super dank, potent, light garlic, tons of passion fruit. Taste is super hoppy, oily weedy hops, prickly spicy hoppiness, pretty awesome. Palate is really nice, good body, good carbonation. Great stuff.
32oz growler from the brewery during the Uppercase release. Poured a slightly hazy yellowish gold with a foamy white head. Aroma/flavor of citrus, juicy, limes, lemon, hop juice, toast, bread crusts.

750 ml bottle poured into a Spiegelau tulip. Bottled 2/19/2015. Very hazy yellowish orange with a good three fingers of off-white head. Aromas of bright grapefruit citrus, floral notes, tropical fruit, pine. Tastes of grapefruit citrus fruit and peel, tropical fruit, floral, bitter hops, a bit of spice. Medium body with a semi-dry finish. Medium carbonation, juicy mouthfeel. Very tasty!

Bottle thanks to Reynolds314! Pours super cloudy amber, medium creamy off-white head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is grassy, pot, dank, tropical, herbal. some citrus. Flavor is light sweet, light plus bitter. Very well integrated and not harsh at all. Clean on the palate, dank, herbal. Medium body, soft mouthfeel. Tasty

Growler. Pours murky orange with a thin white head that lingers at the edges. Beautiful grapefruit hop aroma with mild carbonation. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
bottle thanks to Matt, thanks man! Man i do love the trillium malts flavors. The hops are tasty, citrusy, lingering bitter finish.

The beer is a pale tan yellow color. The head is white and voluminous. Lots of lacing and whatnot. The aroma is full of fruity hop flavor. Big pineapple and tangerine. Lime, orange peel, mango. Light yeasty note. Maybe a little fresh pale malt character but its way in the background. Taste is hoppy with essentially no initial bitterness. The finish is yeasty and dry with lingering moderate bitterness. Very flavorful. Fresh and bright hoppiness. Easy to drink. Soft, full mouthfeel. Another tasty, tasty hoppy beer from Trillium.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2015 Fresh bottle from trade. BIG thanks! Pours murky yellow golden with a one finger fluffyish white head. Looks a little flat on the pour. Aroma of pineapple juice, oranges, lots of tropical citrus here. Flavor is very sweet pineapple juice and orange zest, lightly bitter, twinge of lemongrass. Mouthfeel is fuller and smooth, but this is way on the flat side with nearly no carbonation. Everything is there flavor wise, but this really seems like it might be a bad batch or bottling given the low carbonation, and that really takes away from what seems to otherwise be a delicious treat. Hope to try it again and up the score, though its good as is.
Very opaque yellow colored pour. Big white head. Tons of lacing. Aromas of earth, lemon, yeast and wheat. Taste is the same. Slightly bitter finish. Not bad.

Bomber. Thanks ModeEngage! Hazy gold with a thick, foamy off-white head that lasts and laces. Aromas of mango, peach, pine, earthy notes, light floral and light spice. Flavor is mango, peach,tangerine, pine, light straw and spice notes. Medium bodied, lightly carbonated and a bitter, dry finish.

Poured from bottle into a tulip: This is an incredible IPA. Pours orange with a ncie white head. Aroma is lots of tropical, citrus, and mild resin. Taste is citrus, orange peel, pineapple, and mildly sweet. The sweetness is perfectly balanced with the hop notes. Medium body, perfect carbonation, this is one of the best IPAs Ive had.

Wow, this is one of the best IPAs out there. Hazy orang golden color with foamy head. Aroma is bright citrus, tropical fruits, light dank resin notes and more bright citrus like a freshly peeled orange. Taste is perfectly balanced between moderate bitterness and light sweetness. Smooth well carbonated texture. Trillium is making it less necessary for me to go to Vermont for iPas.
Light golden hazy, fine white foam, grapefruit, geranium, tropical fruit, tangerine, wow. Light bitterness, fairly dry. This is excellent

Bottle shared by hammerslammer- thanks again, Matt! Pours a hazed gold color on the paler side of the spectrum. White head. Big, big aroma - marijuana, citrus fruits (led by lemon, but definitely some grapefruit zest), grass, straw, pale malts, and some tropical fruit notes. Light-medium bodied, with moderate carbonation. Simultaneously clean and flavorful, explosive and balanced. This really knocked my socks off. Great beer.

6 day old bottle from a trade. Pours a cloudy pale orange with a full fluffy white head. Aromas of pineapple, tangerine, light mango, Citra. Taste is medium bitterness, higher than I would like. Medium light body and medium high carb. Great IPA.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy, opaque pale orange. Aroma is dominated by tropical fruit. Smells juicy and delicious. Nice, pronounced bitterness. On the light side of medium bodied; average carbonation. The same lingering bitterness of Trilliums Melcher Street, but Melcher tastes juicier to me.
Very light and lemony, lots of citrus, hops are well done, has a very unique strong taste, complex, well done IPA

Bottle at the Ratebeer mid-Christmas tasting at CBC Clerkenwell. This very likely from Leighton? Clear pale amber, thin white head. Nose is a light and delicate IPA with orange and grapefruit, some lighter subtle notes of peach and tangerine. Taste is orange and grapefruit, peach and tangerine, crisp minerals, little bit of pine. Nice subtle delicate IPA.
Bottle, hazy yellow gold with a thin head, peppery spicy nose with a fruity hint, rich orangey and very quaffable body, perhaps more a pale ale than an IPA, but very nice regardless.

Bottle thanks to WillRunForBeer. Cloudy yellowish-orange pour with a big foamy head head that fades slowly to nice film. Leaves nice lacing too. Aroma is fruity and herbal. Oranges, lemon, lemongrass, melon, grass, and herbal hops. Tastes fairly juicy. Only a touch of bitterness. Citrus, grass, and lemongrass mostly. Hints of pine and biscuits. Medium to full body. Interesting IPA. Not usually a fan of herbal hops but it works pretty well here.

Bottle shared at Kernel Brewery at Zwanze Dat 20/09/2014.Many thanks to Mike. Translucent yellow / straw coloured pour with a lasting white head. Aroma is lovely fruity hops, parma violets, big beer. Flavour is composed of clean straw, base malts, hoppy, light citrus, midget gems, mixed fruit salad. Palate ismedium full, bit of rein on the tongue. Really tasty.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Ariel. Pours yellow like apple puree with a huge head, aroma of lemon, lemon grass, vanilla and melon, flavor is bitter with melon, passion fruit, pineapple, mango skin, great, medium to full bodied.
Bottle thanks to Will. Pours a cloudy orange with small frothy white head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is pine, citrus, grapefruit. Thin mouthfeel, nice pine, grapefruit, light bitterness.
750ml bottle pours a hazy bright yellow color with a lot of frothy head. Nice easy going hop flavors with an aftertaste of bitter orange marmalade. A great IPA.

Hazed golden yellow with huge fluffy head and lacing. Hops are the showcase, malt is there, but only because it needs to be. Citrus, orange, slight tongue tingle. In the mold of the New England style IPA that has become popular (and for good reason).
750mL from Redstone. Bottled yesterday. Pours murky yellow golden with a clingy white head. Aroma is grapefruit, pine, orange. Juicy grapefruit / orange hops. Backbone provides softness.

Hazy orange/yellow with a frothy white head up top. Crisp dank and ashy aromas alongside orange and a little yeast. Flavor pretty much the same but adds some cracker malt. Very little bitterness to be had at all, this really shows off hop flavors rather than fighting out the bitterness war. Great stuff, but I think I prefer their Fort Point Pale Ale.

20th September 2014Zwanze Day at the Kernel. Thanks to Mike. Very hazy gold beer, big fluffy pale cream colour head. Palate is airy and semi dry. Mild fine carbonation. Airy malts. Good floralness. Strong hop spice. Floral skunk and light tropical fruits. Light finish. Very nice indeed.

Bottle split at Mother Arch during the 2014 Zwanze Celebrations, big thanks to Mike Moese, 20/09/14.
Hazed orange with a big old off white covering that retains well.
Nose is danko hoppage, peach, pine, citric peel, light spice, straw.
Taste comprises punchy hops, light mango, citric pithdom, spice, straw.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with juicy hop bitterness.
Solid IPA.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle thanks to Mike. It pours hazy golden-orange with a small white head. The nose is juicy, passion fruit, peach, creamy, tangerine and sherbet. The taste is bitter, juicy, orange, tangerine, peachy, passion fruit, creamy and mild spice with a dry finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Pretty tasty. Juicy and crushable.

Growler, filled & delivered by Leighton - massive thanks. Pours is a pretty opaque bright yellow gold, pretty white head good retention. Aroma is mango, tangerine, apricot, makes me want more before I even drink it. Flavor is solidly juicy, smooth, and fruity throughout, crisp & dry finish. Lightish body, juicy mango & peach, dry light hop finish. Really good, very drinkable.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks Ariel. Murky greenish yellow with a white head. Great hoppy aroma, "green", with lots of tropical fruits. Flavor has a bit of yeast, tons of tropical fruity hops and mild to moderate lingering bitterness. Medium-bodied, rounded mouthfeel. Really good.
Golden pour, frothy white head. Nose is onion, grapefruit, pine. Taste is onion, some citrus. Very bitter finish.
incredibly hazy dark yellow 1 finger creamy head solid white. Smells like tangerine, citrus and grapefruit skin. Sweet finish like splenda. middle is sort of a raw brine orange peel. good mouthfeel.
Pours a hazy orange with a white lacing. Notes of orange citrus and grass I. The aroma. Bitter

64 oz. growler shared by Rob B. Nice unfiltered, cloudy straw color with massive white head. Aroma is damn nice! Grassy and citrus hops with a straw, dried hay element. The flavor is much the same as the nose with fresh juicy citrus turning into a lightly pine and grassy dry bitterness. Bitterness lingers for a good bit after the sip. It is a little abrasive toward the finish but that is what I like about it. Cant wait to try the Heavy Mettle I have a bottle of! This IPA turned me on to this brewery.

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2014 Hazy yellowish orange color, frothy white head. Slightly muted but very fruity aroma of mango, peach, pineapple, orange, and melon. Pleasant sweetness followed by dried citrus peel bitterness. Exceedingly clean finish, crisp, and light. Little to alcohol presence. Earlier Rating: 1/12/2014 Total Score: 4.4Hazy golden orange, moderate white head. Luscious aroma of grapefruit, orange, mango, and peach. Light sweetness that includes a little citrus tang and finishes with mild bitterness. Smooth, crisp, and light-bodied with soft carbonation.

From bottle. Pour is extremely murky, dark golden amber, tight white head. Nose hits you from a distance with a big hop punch. Nose is a bit messy, lots of sugars and malt that arent really tight but a huge citrus punch blasts the nose. Taste is the same, malt is very sporadic and unrefined, doesnt get too sweet but you can tell this is big. Hops really drown out any other flavor, full citrus blast with a hint of tea and a fairly light bitterness for the hop punch. Well carbonated and semi dry finish. Interesting beer, straight up citrus hop heads dream.

From growler, shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: clouded blond beer, nice stable white head.
NOSE: very hoppy and fruity.
TASTE: hoppy, fruity, little too bitter and dry aftertaste for me, but still very nice!

95cl (32oz) growler, at 7.2%Vol, new exclusive American brew Anno 2013, thx to Louis for sharing!, complex bitter brew, fruity/bitter and slightly floral/woody, balanced, cloudy, small head, very good brew

UPDATED: JUL 6, 2015 Bottle. Pours Cloudy yellow with white head. Nose/taste of grapefruit, pine, caramel malt, grass, nectarine pulp and rind and cracker malt. Some sugared pink grapefruit in nose. Medium body.
Growler thanks James. Golden pour with white head. Citrus, grassy, some herbal aromas. Citrus and grassy flavors, nice clean and fresh finish.

Growler shared at The Bruery - big thanks to Andrew for this one. Pours clear gold with a creamy, white head. Lovely stuff, all tangerine, minerals, pithy citrus. Super drinkable. Medium bodied with fine carbonation to average carbonation. Dry finish with some dank pee, more tangerine, flinty minerality. Just really tasty, highly drinkable IPA.

Tap at a dark bar. Pours cloudy yellow with a finger of head but a bit too dark to see true color. Pine, tropical fruit, floral and soft. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Slightly bitter but tasty and smooth finish. Can drink this all evening

Growler courtesy of lousean, shared @ The Bruery. Clear golden pour with a white head. Big, dank, piney nose. Apricot, peach, and pine. Lots of grapefruit, lemon peel, and biscuit. A touch of orange. Flavor is nicely bitter and a touch sweet. Pine, apricot, grapefruit, and peach. Nice grapefruit, orange, and lemon peel.

32oz growler, brokensail loineshawn tag team FTW. Low haze straw pour. Gamey, ripe mango nose. Juicy, tropical. Taste is juicy, quite intense IBU wise. Fresh and powerful. Long, dense mango juice finish. Very nice.

64oz growler pours a very hazy, pineapple yellow with lots of lacing white head. Nose of tropical fruit, some pine, mild grass, lemon peel, soap. Flavor is well balanced, pine, orange, grapefruit juice, some tropical fruit, soap, mild sweetness. Clean finish. Solid. Hides the 7.2% in a dangerous fashion. Dare I say, this is another good example of a "North East IPA".

UPDATED: FEB 7, 2015 Pours hazy gold into a tulip. Bright white head with little retention recedes to hug rim. Yeast, weed, lemon and pineapple aromas. Soft with earthy yeast, stank and caramel upfront turning dry with tropical fruit and resin in the warming finish.

Rather golden yellow color for an IPA, some nice fruits in the nose (mango, lychee) and a little touch of citrus. Fruity taste, very well balanced. Bit bitter and welcome dry in the aftertaste. Overall a very good IPA. (Thanks for the sample Adam!)

32oz growler in a tulip. Pours hazy golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma strong of fruity and floral hops, some pale malts, a little cereal, and light spiciness. Flavor the same with a nice blend of everything. Average texture. A good IPA but the aroma is stronger than the flavor.

UPDATED: DEC 7, 2013 tap offering. i tend to shy away from 7+ percent abv IPAs, as they often come across as too abrasively bitter, or too doughy/caramelly/boozy. well this was just grate. once again, super juicy fresh grapefruit and freshly squeezed clementines. hint of resin keep one on ones toes. pleasant tropical fruit sweetness adds pleasant balance. hops shine. awesome.
